channel.title: range - Tag - The Child is Father of the Man
channel.description: range - Tag - The Child is Father of the Man

item.title: range() and enumerate()
item.author: Author
item.description: The usual way to iterate over a range of numbers or a list in python, is to use range(). Example 0: [code language=“python”] colors = [“yellow”, “red”, “blue”, “white”, “black”] for i in range(len(colors)): print(i, colors[i]) [/code] This should output: [code language=“bash”] (0, ‘yellow’) (1, ‘red’) (2, ‘blue’) (3, ‘white’) (4, ‘black’) [/code] print(), by default, returns a tuple. If we want to print it in a more presentable way, weâ€™ll need to find the indice at which each value is, and print that as well.
